title: Bypass Windows Proxy
author: matthiasballreich
body_snippet:
Is there an option to bypass the configured windows proxy when connecting to some servers? 

If not a option for this would be very helpful, because on my system of the organisation we use a local proxy for the whole traffic, which blocks these connections, so it would be good to bypass the proxy if it is activated under the windows settings.

iterations.description: Implementing a bypass for Windows proxy settings would allow users to connect directly to internal resources, enhancing connectivity flexibility.

notes:
AI triage (gemini): Implementing a bypass for Windows proxy settings would allow users to connect directly to internal resources, enhancing connectivity flexibility.
Approach: Add a boolean 'BypassSystemProxy' property to ConnectionInfo to control proxy usage per connection. Expose this setting in the connection properties UI. Modify the connection establishment logic within each protocol handler (e.g., RdpProtocol, VncProtocol, SshProtocol) to explicitly configure the underlying network client (e.g., HttpClient, WebRequest) to bypass the system proxy if 'BypassSystemProxy' is enabled for that connection.
